9Z1lUEOsWBfsB4ebj7gjBg.text: Chill place with delicious pizza! The pizza is seriously enormous!  One slice will get you full even if you're a giant. I love the inside..super laid back. I also love their large selection of can drinks...not many places you can get cherry coke or cherry Pepsi! Or Vanilla Coke! What what!  Nice parking lot too and easy to get in and out of! Always a plus in Charlotte...

Sohpe82OjUgrUtWDmJnYGg.text: I'm not one to leave reviews on places but this place deserves one. This was my first time here and my last! First off the service is HORRIBLE. They made me feel unwelcomed . I don't know if the guy misheard my order but when I got to my car something told me to check my pizza and my order was wrong. I asked for 2 slices of pepperoni and 1 slice of sausage, I recieved 2 slices of sausage and pepperoni mixed. I politely went inside and said hey I think you heard my order wrong , I paid the difference with no problem. But as I'm waiting I'm watching the cooks throw the pizza around mumbling under their breath and shaking their head  I also heard him angry that they were gonna have to throw the previous order away, I would of kept it  ... I just wanted what I asked for corrected because I don't eat sausage (sausage slice was ordered for a friend) Much attitude ... when my order was ready the man kinda threw my box on the bar and walked away... I won't be back here .... and the pizza isn't even that great !  I was never rude, maybe they don't like black people.. lol but that's ok I know better pizza places!

lLwqnLBz7fqrD3qSPDH9fA.text: Ok. I'm going to make a statement. A pizza statement. Are you ready?   I'm going to judge you if you cut this pizza slice with a knife and fork. Have you seen the size of these things?! This pizza slice is the size of your face. Eat it with your hands! Fold it in half!   I get the cheese pizza slice, it's $4 and you can get full off of it. Perfect. And not only is the pizza the size of your face, it's very good too. Like genuinely good pizza. I love this place. I'll be back. and in the mean time I'll be trying to rationalize driving the whole way to NoDa for a pizza slice. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States

aAsn0ALlVZlzyjLlo47__w.text: I'm giving it a one rating because when I called for a to go order the gentleman decided to tell me to wait in fucking line like everybody else. I have money which everybody worships and I'm willing to give out every bit of money and love but this one guy decided to be hateful.

zQAzvRBSnmDmXliVvAblnw.text: One of the best places to get pizza in all of Charlotte. The taste is impeccable and they have two unique flavors every month to change things up! It's $5 for a cheese slice or $6 for a slice with toppings. You'll only need one slice and it's well worth the money. If you go, download Stealz, you can get a free King of Pops popsicle your first visit through the app!

dNFsgbDXDgIdk_pKFAoXjw.text: The reason I'm giving 1 star is because we've sat for 30 mins TWO separate times, just to be told our "ticket was lost". We were the ONLY guest in the establishment! No one came in until 5 mins later.... ALL of which (4 tables) got there food BEFORE us. I'm over Benny's. I gave another chance & came back despite being aggravated from the FIRST time! They are NOT sanitary! The workers drink BEER in the back room while making pizza! The pizza is good but this is unacceptable Benny's. Also, was very disrespected by "Doc" the man who worked the front today 11-8-2018 when I was there between 5PM-8PM (can't remember the timing). He was VERY rude from the start when I asked him what was on a pizza, he looked at me like I was stupid while giving me my answer! Also saying "whatever" to the things we genuinely had questions about & arguing with us on things we addressed from a previous visit. ARGUING & having attitudes with a customer isn't very work professional man. Morgan the manager made sure he addressed the issue with us, gave us a free slice card, & promised he'd fix things so thank you to him he calmed me down a bit. I'm just very upset with my visit more than anything from being disrespected than the wait AGAIN for my pizza.

9cgb1Bag4yEj5eMb7GEvVA.text: Good pizza. Not amazing, but solid. Huge slices. The atmosphere is cool, especially the music. The customer service is excellent. The decor is far from a 10, but it fits the NoDa vibe. There are several tables inside, most of them large, but some of them are near the bathrooms. There are two picnic tables outside, but they're next to the parking lot. If you want to chill outside, go to the brewery next door.   Overall, I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here, but it's definitely worth a visit if you're in the area.

j8-Lpd42PxkmHY8xy5XjzQ.text: Compared to the other ratings I see, 3 stars may feel like a slap in the face. I was really hoping Charlotte finally had a place that could figure out pizza. But it looks like we'll still have to stick to BBQ. The pizza was fine. Definitely not bad.  I was just hoping for more.   The slice is huge, but more of average doesn't always equal great (i.e. The Golden Corral model...if I eat a stack of newspapers, I'll be full, GC, but that doesn't make the newspapers worth eating)  Also, you pay for the giant slice ($5), so it's not the greatest deal. *sips haterade*   and did anyone check out the price of a full pizza from Benny's?!?!.....I know it's NODA, but do you know how high I would have to be to order a $38 pizza from this place???...I mean...damn...a family of 12 could live off dominos for 5 yrs for that price.

w-Jd3QmMjbwBEMf1JtbyzA.text: So I've been coming here for about a month since a friend turned me on.  The pizza is really good but one of the staff members that works there always seems to have an attitude when I visit.  Look I get it we all have our bad days but seriously the last 3 times I've went in this dude is a total douchebag not to just the other employees but towards the customers as well.  Even my friend that was with me was commenting on how angry the employee was.  The last time after I got my food I wanted a ranch cup with it the same guy was working and he told me it would be 50 cents so I'm like sure.  I asked him for the ranch and the guy snaps back at me in a rude tone "no he will get you at the register" even though he's standing right in front of the fridge that has the ranch cups in them.  My food is getting cold and there was about 3 more people waiting in line.  So I go and sit back down to eat since I'm obviously not getting this ranch anytime soon.  I wait on the line to clear out and once again go up to pay for the ranch.  The guy at the register ends up giving me the ranch free which was cool but he has to wait for the rude employee to move out of the way of the fridge to even get me the ranch.  Like really they need to watch how they come off at me because next time I'm probably going to lose my cool and cuss you out for the disrespect.  Today I went in for some Joes Tea I asked the same guy how much the drink cost and the attitude starts.  There is about 5 people waiting to checkout so I ask if I can just leave the three bucks and go because I had an order to deliver so the employee with a bad attitude decides to yell back no you have to wait for him Pointing at the other guy running the cash register.  I'm livid at this point because I don't know who the hell you think you are talking to with that tone of voice.  It took all I had to not come across that counter.  I even asked you how you were trying to be nice and yet you still cop an attitude towards me.  I'm done trying to be nice so the next time I go if the same guy starts with the attitude I'm not letting it slide I will make a scene and give that attitude right back you.  You have to give respect to get respect with me and right now this guy is on my bad side.  If you don't like your job or don't want to work QUIT I know plenty of people who would love to have your job.  No need to come in and make everyone else's day miserable by being a total dick.  Keep that ass at home boy with that nasty attitude of yours.  I don't remember or care to know your name just know I know your face that's all that matters.  If the pizza wasn't so good I'd choose to go somewhere else.  Whoever he is please get him some proper customer service or hospitality training.

HZRZ3K0JL-nzeQDGQ2Q7zw.text: The pizza here is gigantic. I can never finish a slice. I think it is mostly good, but at times thin and greasy.  It just depends on the day.  Inconsistent is not good, but 4 stars for convenient hours, location, price and beer selection. The service is always good also.

photos.caption: Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Garlic mushroom

1eBQCkp61EmvgpQcWHo47g.text: Updated because the pizza was well worth the wait. Two stars originally because DoorDash deliveries require the driver to arrive and sit in the restaurant while they prepare the pizza. They will not start to make the pie until the driver arrives. Thanks to the driver for informing us. Must be nice to have enough business to keep such a policy. Papa Johns next time I want a pie delivered.

m2epO-dCp-mqpUDrVhu7nQ.text: Hands down, one of the best pizza by the slice places. They have art, enough breathing room in the restaurant that you're not like on top of people, and it was very clean. The whole pies are huge and great for groups. I had the classic pepperoni and cheese but they also have amazing other variations and slices. A great spot for a date, not to mention it is right next to Heist Brewery.

ozxjHQVZ5KIs9UBQ4Q8uew.text: Benny's has the biggest and most scrumptious pizza in Charlotte! The huge slices are not only fun to eat but they are well made with quality ingredients. The employees are always friendly and attentive and the owners are amazing! They also have an excellent choice of drinks and prices are excellent. Always a pleasure to come in and see the monthly specials.

photos.caption: Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pesto chicken! Yum!!!

cyZYFzKWrHYJzzGucTRpZw.text: Nothing really special about their pizzas except for the size at a decent price. Maybe I'd change my opinion if I ever got a chance to have a fresh slice, but every time I've gone it's the same stale quality as Fuel.

tqIMMS0bZ8dq0F_Db07ufQ.text: When your have had a late night in NoDa this is a great place. The pizza is mediocre but worth giving a try.

FQpulmkneLMsvXQNsETTxQ.text: I've seen this place on various social media sites and picked it for a recent date night. Parking was easy. Ordering was easy. The guy behind the counter was super friendly. The ambiance and vibe inside is cool.   My fella and I both ordered a slice of mushroom garlic and a drink. I think this place is reasonably priced, especially considering what you get for the money. The pizza slice was HUGE (as all of the pictures on Yelp depict) and it was sooooooo yummy. It was hard for me to finish one slice but my man said he could have eaten two slices. I don't know about thaaaaaaaat but I do know that it is delicious and you should go! We are looking forward to coming back!

Pabsk3_mMM1OfQeTXgLVHA.text: My kids love this place! Huge pizza slices for $4 it doesn't get any better than that. They have a patio out side brewery inside.  Check this place out if you haven't.

klHPU6Bm6zTgaYyludcHfw.text: Pizza is massive! They have a vegetarian and a meat special monthly, as well as a few staple pies. We came here with a big group before going out and one slice was enough for dinner. It did take almost 20 min from ordering to getting my slice, but I didn't mind.

K0DnX1wQeiD85zfYcgvQbg.text: I enjoyed my Huge slice of Pepperoni Pizza for $5 a slice. I was thinking hmmmm.... for $5/slice I could get a small pizza, but not here! The slice of pizza was basically like a small pizza and totally worth the price. The staff was friendly and the restaurant was clean. The ambiance is very eclectic and perfect for the NoDa artsy laid back scene. Most pizza places give you huge slices of dough where they skimp out on the toppings but not here! The dough wasn't thick and the sauce to toppings ratio (if that's really a thing lol) was perfect. Buen Provecho! Mama Ragu signing Out! Peace

photos.caption: Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yummy pepperoni  pizza $5

4PFJT9q7EWhcMQrlIQ-3sg.text: Great Pizza, staff is amazingly friendly, they got things down to a system! If you're in Noda and want some pizza definitely check it out. The quantity won't disappoint. The late hours are really useful for those who get out of work late and want to sit down.

B5ov4F3Ica-IDzPqyEOLxg.text: Terrible service, and mediocre pizza stored in dangerous, dirty conditions. My wife and I went to Benny Pennelo's for the first time at about 6:00PM, on a slow, rainy Friday.   Service--There were were between two and five employees behind the counter at all times, and no lines. Yet, no one acknowledged us. We first stood at the counter. Nothing. We moved to the counter and leaned on it, while trying to make eye contact with employees. They pretended we were invisible.  I moved and waited by the register. Still nothing. We wondered if we were supposed to seat ourselves. So, we sat at the bar and waited, and waited. Nothing! Finally, I walked over and gruffly grabbed the attention of an employee, who made it clear he didn't care. However, he did condescend to take our order.  Health Risk--while we waited, we saw them retrieve cold pizza from racks under the counter, just a few inches off the dirty floor. The pizzas were not in boxes or covered. Just exposed on baking trays. There was trash and dirt inches below the exposed pizzas. Workers' knees, shins, and hairy legs were grazing the pizzas. Their feet were kicking up dirt around and onto the pizzas. Brooms would have churned up dust on the pizzas if these guys swept.   The Food--My wife and I [stupidly?] tried the pizza anyway. The cheese and crust were perfect. Neither overcooked nor undercooked. Someone forgot to finish putting on sauce, and sauce was lacking by _any_ standard. The price was reasonable at $4.00 for each large cheese slice. The price for a whole pie was competitive considering the size. I almost gave Benny's a second star for how perfectly the owner(s) have the oven set up, but the filthy conditions prevent that.  Summary--The bottom line is the under-counter pizza storage area/bacteria farm is dangerous, and the employees drive customers away. Buyer beware! Walk around to the side and look under the front counter that is closest to the front door. If the pizza is still exposed by the floor, walk away. Mediocre food isn't worth the horrible service or the health risk. This is my first bad review of any place on Yelp, but Charlotte, beware!

Vv5Y_yMUPW0GHfXeL5qg-g.text: The pizza was exceptional! The service, though, was terrible. We were greeted by a larger built guy with a hat and long hair; reminded us of Post Malone. He had zero people skills. However, we ordered and then sat down on the opposite end of the bar where there was space to sit. When our pizza was ready, he shouted our name. I raised my hand, feet from him, and he said "Come get your shit, I ain't bringing it to you!". Come on, you HAVE to have better service. You could have had a gentle response if you didn't want to carry stuff 10 feet over.   All of that said, the pizza is fantastic, great crust and cheese. However, off putting customer service will keep me from going out of my way to get here next time.

Zmlxot2JX6C-oruUEJ2C2Q.text: So bad and so good that is right next to my house. I go then more often that I should but the pizza is not just big but also very good.  Every month they change the specials and I always try the veggie special, as I don't eat meat and is kind of cool being able to try different stuff, sometimes is very creative.  I always get there when I am starving thinking I could eat the whole pie but I have never done more than 2 slices, they are sooooo big!

pkCIYovDI-Cm7VG--k0_4A.text: Welcome to New York, Charlotte! These pizza slices are roughly the size of New York State, at least. Myself and three friends split a large pepperoni and there was still some left over. Mostly because I didn't want to embarrass anyone with my extreme ability to consume pizza but that's a different story.   Slightly strange counter service type atmosphere but once you get the idea, it's a nice place to hang out. They offer some unique beers and a few domestics. It's not an easy place to get to on the weekends since the parking in the area is a challenge. If you are within a mile or two, I suggest you walk.   Really delicious, New York style pizza and I've had a few pizzas in NYC. Definitely comparable.

pYNJKUTRUvy-QPCk5JZ5vQ.text: Good "slice" pizza is hard to find in the south. Benny's giant slices remind me of Adams Morgan in DC. A great assist to hue NODA area. Benny's slices are worth it. Ive even came back and ordered a whole pizza. Boy!

uiCHXtn9lxnUbUp3yw6edw.text: First time at Benny's. The pizza was delicious. Unlike any other pizzeria in Charlotte, this pizza was the most similar to NY pizza. The slices are huge. We split one slice and we were full. No need to post anymore. If you're hungry and want pizza--- go to Benny's.

3qlbHEt9exm2wCBsokn43A.text: Was very surprised by how big the slices were! One slice was more than enough. Cool place with a very cool vibe. Plenty of seating and artwork to fill the walls. Definitely going back next time i'm in NoDa!

photos.caption: Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States

1M5q1TIbJMqqvkuRR5PPIQ.text: I'm here right now to enjoy some of the best Piz,a in Charlotte. The crust is crispy and delicious. My new favorite place to enjoy a huge slice of heaven!

3OCiYR8cPs3Wd8-mf14TQQ.text: I'll start by saying I eat here probably once every week or every other week. With that being said it's obviously great pizza ; even great enough for me to tell all my friends and family about it. But for the first in like two years Benny let me down . I came in yesterday evening with my younger sister ... to make a long story short ; whoever the Post Malone looking dude is was making us uncomfortable. I don't know if he had an attitude all night or just when we walked in but he was slamming things and cursing under his breath but loud enough for me and my sister to hear him. Walking from he behind the counter and swinging the front door Wildly to leave (still while cursing) and even wilder to come back. Dude was just rude and his vibe didn't fit the atmosphere at all.   That was enough to make me not want to come back... ever. I know you all don't care about me (just one measly customer) ever coming back. But I loved Benny's it was my one chill spot where I knew I could come in super stoned and just enjoy my pizza in peace. And that blows.

vGiiwFhq04HTA32MRbnwsw.text: We really liked this Benny Pennello's. Giant pizza slices for around $5 each. We fed our whole family for less than $30. Our kids were excited about how gigantic their slices of pizza were. We liked the laid back atmosphere. The music was a little loud even for us, but the volume level is better toward the back of the restaurant. Overall it was a great experience, and we will definitely come back with friends.

yGQaGhauDNjP9DT9_jopFA.text: Got there around 9pm tonight.  Stood in front of the pizza oven for a bit.   The employees are all walking around.  A few minutes later, I moved over the cash register. Stood there a few minutes.   Still no one took my order.  A few minutes later an employee cane over, stood in front of me and did everything except make eye contact with me.  I asked him, who's suppose to take my order. He points to a guy "selling T-shirt's" to drunk girls.  I said, "him, he's too busy trying to get laid!"   "Good night guys" and left.    If I were management I would review the tape. You had at least 3 employees working tonight.  None of whom thought it was appropriate to great me or take an order.   Wishing you luck.

Q42qy-x_quJe6BlnoEWCDQ.text: Divey pizza spot in NoDa that is quite busy on weekend late nights. Huge pies are being made here, local beer is on tap and cans are available too. I had a simple slice of cheese and it definitely hit the spot.

wLEqaosrW4GMJBUJMevh4g.text: Went on a Saturday around 11:15 am, quiet but I don't like crowds..The son and me each had a cheese slice..Tasted very good (def. In the NY style vein)Was excellent for the size (HUGE!!) and price.. $ 4 each..Easily twice the size of most other places..Got a parking spot right in front but I'm guessing parking could get tight..Will return with my wife..

photos.caption: Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biggest slice ever!!

T_u7zvDZ55vLtkYM-3e7Jw.text: Ginormous oven huge pizzas.  Pepp is $5 a slice and very cheesy new York style.  Little wait. Was busy.   The crowd were certainly all under the influence  of some plants and liquids for sure.   That part isn't my favorite but the pizza is fantastic.   We had a good time anyway!!   Cheesy huge New York pizza isn't the most common thing in town and they've got it going on.  Can go very late too.

90uwuNwGggXIH9VQJowIQA.text: Massive slices and very tasty.  I ordered a sausage to eat in which was crispy and delicious.  I also got a pepperoni to go for tomorrow.  It would be amazing after a night of drinking!

-gchQjFXcGE5PCRl-N0OeQ.text: Waste of time, money, and calories. After the pizza stop I was recommended to go to was closed, I googled the next closest place.  Honestly, I should have just ordered from a delivery service.  For one, the guys behind the counter were incredibly rude to me and other customers that came in. They never gave me my drink and when I asked after waiting 15 minutes for it, they ignored me. They also openly made fun of a girl who didn't know what the ordering process was.  Next, the pizza itself was not good at all. Yes, the slices are huge which is their "thing" but I'd rather get a smaller slice that is better quality. The dough was awful and salty while the cheese and pepperonis were bland and had no flavor (I tried each part individually trying to figure out why it tasted so bad).   The only reason I am giving them 2 stars is because the interior was visually interesting with exposed brick and the music wasn't awful.  Other than that, this place just isn't worth it unless you want to watch frat boys turned hipster chug PBR and hit on girls that are so intoxicated they are falling off the bar stools.

8Ul_uko2fGMnCTgY4WoU1w.text: This is the closest I have come to "boardwalk pie" or Jersey style pizza. The crispy crust on the bottom that crunches as you fold it (and yes, you fold your pizza) and the gooey melty cheese brought me right back to my hometown. The slices are massive, as in two paper plates massive, but so delicious. I also love that it's not downing in pizza sauce, the pizza lets the cheese and toppings do the talking. Even writing this review I want to go back there and get another slice.   It's $4 for a plain slice and $5 for sausage/pepperoni or garlic mushroom.

photos.caption: Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Was too hungry to take a picture first. Garlic mushroom slice.

AFagAJC7IbBeO8oX6JwymA.text: I love pizza, and what I love even more is pizza by the slice ! Benny's delivers! They only offer pizza, and only a select variety. But, when it's as good as it is I am fine with that.   On my recent visit I went with the pepperoni, the slice was amazing. The perfect temperature, crisp but soft crust and the cheese ratio was on point. Although the slice was gigantic, as you can see from all of the photos, I had no issues finishing it! And, as others have said, I love the old school soda options, and they recently started serving beer, yippee!! I definite stop for me again when I am craving a slice of pie!

photos.caption: Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States

5MgXQ_LM0nM1nl0YJuqp6g.text: This is pizza at its finest..well maybe not finest but, Benny's is pretty bomb pizza joint. The slices are GIGANTIC, they hand it to you on two paper plates its so long. A slice of cheese is $4 vs. a whole pizza $30.. extra for toppings of course. This is super satisfying NY style pizza you just fold and stuff your face with. I love the crunchy crust. It also has a great sauce to cheese ratio. The best drunk munchies if you stumbling over from Heist.   Local brews and other drinks are available as well. Staff is nice. We will be back for sure. Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States. So big it needs 2 plates!

Mpyj5_TNaI1Sw4K6BtQjXw.text: A Charlotte gem in the right location, the pizza here truly never disappoints. Their cheese slice is my go to but I also enjoy their veggie option of the month. This is a spot you have to try if you're in the mood for GREAT pizza!

oXF1LfU7f5nXWs3aB_DIHA.text: Wonderful place with great pizza. It was so good, i left after eating one slice, came back and got another one. Nice, fresh and HUGH!! Probably some of the best pizza I've had in all of Charlotte. I'm ecstatic for a pizza place such as this in the NODA area. If you want good, fresh and really BIG pizza, this is the place to go. Will definitely be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States. This is the size of a whole pie. Couldn&#39;t even get all of it in my camera
Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States. BIG PIZZA

Faf2GjI3I4Ewwn8LYeyA4g.text: The slice of pizza is literally the size of my forearm. It is huge. The good thing is there is no loss of quality in taste and texture in the pizza this size. I think Bennys does it well and offer great basic pizza as well as good new flavors. If you are in NoDa and been drinking - this slice of pizza will feed the whole squad!

CiKJG271TXYXqyj1f5v5EQ.text: Its fine. I would go here if in the area and needed pizza but I'll never make a trip out of the way for it. This is my standard 3 star review.

k5qo5e7EEAleNFSvWp0Eww.text: Biggest pizza you have ever seen. One slice and I was done. Had the jalapeno and bacon pizza.  It was the perfect thin crust. This place has a college campus feel - without the beer??  (Hopefully they get that fixed soon). Drinks are cans out of a cooler.  Definitely a cheap date kind of place, but the pizza can't be beat!  I will def be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States

WtD-nRYTKA2XTnvdoRFskA.text: Awesome New York style pizza, and holy crap the slices are big!  It's tough to find a good pizza-by-the-slice place in this area, and these guys nail it.  Great soda selection too. The location next to Heist is perfect, because there's nothing better than a slice of pizza after getting a few beers.

49DZT2DHz-oe4lQ354hyEA.text: Solid late night pizza spot. All of the other restaurants in the NoDa area seem to close at 2 a.m., but Benny's is open until 3 a.m. serving both slices (pepperoni and cheese only at late night) and whole pies.  The slices are enormous. $4 gets you a 13" behemoth with well browned cheese and a nice, crisp bottomed crust - solid value. At the time of my visit, they didn't have beer sales yet (really the only reason for no 5-star), but I assume they're getting their licensing in order to fix that. Overall, good eats.

QMm3Eqet3ZnoKqt_Yeh65g.text: I have heard about Benny's for a while, but my wife and I finally got over to check it out. The atmosphere is fun and relaxed, and in True NODA fashion, a little bit funky. The size of the slice is worth the visit.  It was massive, and I tried to down two slices, but didn't make it through the crust.  The pizza has a great taste. It seemed like the pizza was made from high quality ingredients, and I enjoyed the slightly sweet tasting sauce. Definitely will go back, and the next time our family is in town we might just order a full pie, which would probably feed six people.

A9HRziwgSZjlL96VwyTHXQ.text: I love pizza and wasn't a fan of their garlic mushroom slices. Mushrooms had no taste of garlic or period but the slices were huge and I'd go back for cheese pizza if my top choices were closed.

ERjMAbwF0QFuqQVvXO9DEA.text: Solid late night pizza joint. Nothing fancy, just giant slices of pizza. Best to buy it by the slice, and entire pizza runs you roughly $30 and unless you have a truck you may not be able to fit it into a regular car.

photos.caption: Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Box is bigger than my stovetop. Had to use 2 gal storage bags for the slices

pQCCMgoDTGFwNVnezua9fg.text: This place is great!  The slices are huge and delicious and the have a diverse selection of craft beers.  The staff is super friendly and easy going.

f2U7wyf-8N4Oz0xKYagi4g.text: I googled the best pizza in Charlotte and Benny's came up amongst others. I no longer eat commercial, chain pizzas so I was excited to try something different. After looking at the pics on Yelp, I decided that Benny's would give me the most bang for my buck. A medium sized dwelling right next door to Heist brewery. They sell local craft beer and old school soft drinks in cans!! The pizza was phenomenal! A giant slice served on two paper plates. Hot, crispy on the bottom and delicious. I usually enjoy more than one topping on my slice but this thin crust pizza is so flavorful you don't miss the additional toppings. I'm going back tmrw for two more slices. My new pizza place. Thank you Benny's Penn's in NODA!

_y_fGhjfaHy0vS8HP-fWtw.text: Live close to here so it's dangerous for my diet. Perfect place to grab a (huge) slice after a night out. They usually stay open after bars close so you can grab another brew from the fridge and/or stuff your face (like I do) with some awesome pizza. Just don't mistake the Parmesan shaker for the salt shaker like I did last time

0EsyaiuSgnHbwLlVw68JJg.text: Holy cow! I can say I was thoroughly surprised with the quality of the pizza here! Coming from a person who has been spoiled by New York pizza his entire life, I would have never associated Virginia with having a quality pizza slice. The crust was almost perfect, and the sauce/cheese ratio was just right as well. I like my pizza thin crust, not too much cheese, and full of fresh flavor. This pizza stepped up to that expectation. Only request I would have, is that they would be a little bit more generous with the toppings when ordered on a pizza. My Fiance ordered the Chicken Alfredo pizza, and wasn't very satisfied with the amount chicken that was put on there. Looking at the pictures seen on the Yelp page though, it seems it wasn't very consistent in person than it was in the pictures seen. Overall, this place has gained a fan! Did I mention that they serve craft beer, and they are open late?! I don't live in NoDa, and it is a little bit of a hike for me, but rest assured I will be back in the near future.

photos.caption: Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Stupid big slices!

MFwVwQvbRtNPE0BFmTSFew.text: Great atmosphere, good selection. You only need to order one slice at a time. VERY BIG PIECES. Not so much gourmet, but if you don't care about carbs, this place will satisfy your cravings.

WGyV-Og4BZFHh-o82NgsYA.text: Love the big slices and quick service. Reasonable price and chill atmosphere. I'll be back.

pkLjvatnpW8ZCBmH6mvIaA.text: The pizza is always great but today (July 26th, 2017 8:35pm) the young man at the register was fairly rude. Not sure if he was having a bad day but he surely made me feel unwelcome. SN: I still left a tip.

RbajurVbZ_dlG5oSwG_UZg.text: Delish pizza! Giant slices so you only need one.

-l81fY1hs2VlQPiER-Ru1A.text: Touring band VINILOVERSUS this is our first time playing in Charlotte! Amazing pizza! Better than what I have eaten for this year (pizza wise) Great place totally recommend it!!!

Kj8GDqJYzIhzjVlJHInl_g.text: Slices bigger than your face for chump change. Can't beat Benny's for a quick bite. The pizza is not only huge but it's tasty.

l47REfFmPs9r4iWDzEIwtw.text: Pizza is ok, but have been sitting here for 36 minutes waiting for my order of one slice.

MvZQ4VXGTDa8GIg3-995hg.text: Oh boy!!!!! Time to pack on the pounds. This pizza is awesome! The crust is perfectly crispy and the slices are HUGE! I am so glad a pizza joint came to the neighborhood. The wife won't be too happy about this good stuff! They just opened tonight so come check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States. As big as my head!

L3Fz5vk3R8Qdof6K-hmQeg.text: Perfect amount of sauce, cheese, toppings. Crust was good. Thinner crust. Perfectly balanced. Monstrous sized.

ypKSnI7Uw3rdJdHo8QmEtg.text: So the pizza itself is fine.  A nice big piece and the crust was nice.  My issue is that they take cheese slices and then put on whatever toppings you want and bake it.  So the toppings aren't integrated in the pizza.  For example, the garlic mushroom was a cheese slice with a pile of mushrooms (the slimy kind).  In addition, the mushrooms were only lukewarm.  I didn't order the BBQ chicken but I saw it and it looked like a cheese slice that had BBQ sauce and chicken on it.  In my mind, that's not what a BBQ chicken pizza is.

CRKrmrHc_btvq6D9fU3e5A.text: Hands down best pizza I've had in the Charlotte area thus far. Something about the fluffy, yet crispy, crust is just phenomenal. Each month they have both a meat and veggie specialty pie, alongside their already phenomenal regular menu options, all of which can be ordered by the slice. Not only is the 'Za amazing, the staff is equally just that as well. Super friendly and personable.   Bottom line- If you're from out of town and just looking for a good slice, come here. Or if you're a local just looking to broaden your pie portfolio, this is your spot. Orrrrrr if you're on the fence about checking this place out, what are you waiting for? Just do it already!

0NUriJ5C4bC5V4i2QG1O0A.text: I don't like to complain about restaurants but this is the worst of the worst. Horrible service, staff are bullies, and the manager is an alcoholic mess. Do not bring children here as mine were hooted on by drunks and disrespectful staff. The cashier was rude and charged me $1.35 extra and I didn't notice until after. Never go here I beg of you!

WL3L-YUXSVAZDrOBjO4NBw.text: Best pizza in Charlotte by far and definitely the best bang for your buck. One slice puts you in a well enough food coma for a while.

_bKoCsKesg67uXTo_xFMSQ.text: SO happy that Benny's is now in Charlotte. I have eaten at both their Radford and Blacksburg, VA locations as that is where I used to live. You can go in and grab a huge slice of pizza for a round $4, perfect for lunch. They always have cheese and then pepperoni but each month they feature a special.  It looks like the Charlotte location is actually going to make sure to do 1 vegetarian special as well as 1 meat special, not 100% on that though. The Charlotte location is also bigger than some of their other locations which is nice. It's super delicious classic pizza, a slice the size of your head... what's not to love?

82QGeTOB_NrPxXYM-yGlNw.text: I visited a few days ago for this yummy huge slice of pizza I heard about. Unfortunately, it was a HUGE miss. 1) the dough tasted similar to the smell of play dough (Not even sure how that's possible) 2) the cheese had an odd taste as well. 3) Because it was so hot outside I asked only for a cup of water, well the water cooler was out of water, so I politely brought it to two of the workers attention, and their response was pretty much like I was being a pest and that was a task they didn't want to do. Even if the pizza was the best thing I'd ever tasted, I would never come back because of that type of attitude!

Axy3fMrB9HTdjWG5Lonxaw.text: My wife and I have had lunch here several times.  You go here to have pizza, if you want something else, go somewhere else.  I wouldn't order more than one slice either or you're probably not going to finish it.  When someone orders a pizza to carry out, they have to tip the box sideways to get it through the door.  :-)  Cool place, good music, great variety of drinks.  Nothing fancy but that's exactly what's so cool about it.

uiwBYqpPSBc_Umk7otWt6w.text: I have been to this place several times now.  It's all the slice!  First off, what a fun way to have a slice of pizza.  The building itself is also pretty cool.

kCSchzc5fXbuD_BGw3aDnQ.text: One of my favorite pizza places in Charlotte! Not only is the pizza good, but the slices are enormous - like 3 times the size of my face. One slice is all most people would need, so you're looking at a $5-6 lunch or dinner. Not bad! The interior looks kind of crummy, but once you try the pizza, you'll forgive them and be back.

GVrtyGnqL1siDWrz2rMLZQ.text: Wow! I loved Benny's while at Virginia tech but this is a whole new level! Great atmosphere and pizza!  Awesome murals they are putting together inside too

zMQl-UCbKoKvBnc-cYP9dg.text: Best pizza in town hands down! Always fresh and every month they have different specialty pizzas! They also have a freezer full of king of pops as well!

_9RnbdAIyR3clelW9sFiwA.text: The crust. OMG the crust is to die for. The grab and go drink station is also cool. Plenty of choices

e_Qniw11usHloGR-fdlrVg.text: This location is within walking distance, which is very dangerous in regards to the amount of money I spend and pizza that I eat.  Friendly staff and generally quick service.  I have eaten here several times in the past few months.  I would love to give Benny's a slightly higher rating, and on certain days I probably would, but my most recent experience was lukewarm re-heated that might have been from the day before; we were eating it for lunch last Sunday.  We will certainly try again as we love the curst and the enormous serving size, but it is tremendously better when it is fresh and not re-heated.

hW8D1JFmAHGjJLsWvNxc3g.text: If you like jumbo slices of pizza, you gotta try this place. Their pizza is thin and the crust is crisp... So if you are a Chicago or pan pizza lover, this might not be for you.  They always have cheese, pepperoni, sausage, and a special. The last special I had was cheesesteak - it was good and I think there was wiz on it (like a proper cheesesteak would have), but it was a bit too much cheese for me with the mozz already there too. I usually just get the regular cheese - a slice is $4 and it's worth every penny.   Bring your appetite, fold the slice in half, and enjoy!

s4ABxfHv3yS1kN3xyLZotg.text: Great NY Style pies!! And the slices are the largest I've ever seen. Fun place with $2 PBR pounders as a bonus.

JlE1K9Dp46_AJQstoQMUKA.text: I really like Benny Pennello's! I'm giving it a 3 because of quality for the price.  Very affordable and the pizza slices are huge. My only recommendation is to stick with a Cheese Slice. The toppings are a bit underwhelming and take away from the pizza. The taste and quality of the cheese pizza can stand alone and will satisfy any pizza craving that you may have and not to mention, it's cheaper to stick with a slice of cheese This chain is growing. I'm originally from Virginia and had it for the first time in Roanoke. I'm very happy to see them expanding their reach.

n-67Z6WhGIXugoynt6VYEw.text: Thank's to Benny Pennello's I am now a size queen.  I remember growing up in the dirty jersey and hitting the shore for giant slices of pizza.  Benny's are even bigger than these slices.  Not only can you be full off of one slice, but good god the pizza is actually good.  This might be my new go to pizza place.

IjLiK5LKXFH6zVphzaw6ug.text: HUGE PIZZAS! This is my favorite Pizza spot in Charlotte. Don't expect a fancy or even multi topping pizza, just straight cheese or pepperoni. They sell by the slice which one slice is the size of 3 of most places slices. Thin, crispy, just the right amount of greasy.   Great to stop here after a night of drinking in NODA. Seems like they are always busy.  They don't deliver so you have to use Postmates to get it delivered to your place which is the only thing I dislike about Benny's. Also if you order a whole pizza make sure you can fit it in your car, you may have to put a seat down or tilt it to get it through your door..no seriously it's that big.

USfGu4RpKrXtYJtEPTpiUA.text: Great environment! Awesome price for the size of the slice. I had the Special of the Month, which was the buffalo chicken pizza. The best buffalo chicken pizza I've ever had. The chicken was so moist and tender. Sauce was on point. My new favorite pizza place in Charlotte.

Mr-hcVtVCBudkoYiyO0JfA.text: This Pizzeria is a must do when visiting the town of NoDA. You can buy a pizza slice and carry it on the go. The slices are HUGE! The pizza slices come out soon after ordering and are super cheap! I would highly recommend this place!

SqP2dL6iIprk6Q6vDkWhLA.text: It's very cool spot that sat place just right and people are very friendly and helpful make the  go according to plans

ENOGhSTstHTCGK_iSGiv2Q.text: Benny's is my favorite pizza in Charlotte. If you are going to order a whole pizza, make sure you look at the size of the slices first. They are huge! I usually get a slice of pepperoni and  that is enough to fill me up. It is $5 and about the size of 3 "normal" slices of pizza. The sign is somewhat blended into the brick, but its connected to Heist. I am excited to try one of their other locations in Virginia when I am up visiting family.

MJE9LLS8yUqbd1-2wKkCGA.text: This place definitely lives up to the hype. I went and just got a classic pepperoni slice. Staff was amazing. As I waited I seen the other pizzas coming out. These whole pies are gigantic. Its definitely worth the price. I'm a New York pizza style girl and I was very please with my slice. They have a regular customer out of me.

eW9tDns8QG8F03XnTz4Vow.text: One of my go to places for pizza. Where else can I get a pizza slice that's bigger than my head and it's actually good? It's not super greasy, which I hate. You can get a slice for $5 or a whole pizza for about $30 which I wouldn't recommend unless you have a larger group to feed. The whole size took up the whole trunk!

odwTDDfWoIR7Bx1cxAcbcA.text: I get the hype about the big slices. I even get the hype about the quick service, especially when there's an extremely long line. But I don't get the flavor. My homie did tell me the flavor of my slice was off. I got cheese btw. However when I tried his man's slice, I still wasn't feelin it. Nope not for me!   But imma give them a second chance. Because orders were gettin mixed up, people couldn't hear there names being called, one guy left out with the wrong order, pizza dude trying to chase him down, pizza dudes and check out dude were shaking their heads with the amount of customers flowing through the door. It was too much going on.   I can't imagine this place being any different on a Saturday night after people have been drinking. All the greasy food joints are going to be packed. And they in NODA too where all these places around them are jumpin? Come on now.   I'll check them out on a weekday and see what they're talkin about.

photos.caption: Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States. This is just proof I was here

XJFm0HN-kHhhJQBJRK12OQ.text: Super dig this place. Eclectic patrons, friendly staff, open late, slices bigger than your face, pizza by the slice, and my favorite beers. Oh, and did I mention it's tasty AF. It's the equivalent or probably better than any awesome joint you might hit after a heavy night of boozing it up with pals. I mean it's no 24-hour taco shop, but it's the next best thing.

photos.caption: Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pizza slice and beer

jEtwZlC65ihSAugw-Kfc1A.text: Every time I go to Benny's I leave happy and with a full stomach! Their pizza is delicious! My friends and I shared a full pie and I tried to take a photo with my hand for reference, but the pizza was bigger than my stovetop so that's even better. Full pie has 8 giant slices.   Dining in is fun because they have a lot of local beers in cans and it's usually pretty chill. You can get water from a cooler and cup in the back.

photos.caption: Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States

_iWHpXSRmB5cjAyEvgWTHQ.text: This place is dope. Carson, the guy who does the cool designs on the to go bags is the man. Love that guy. Pizza's good too

XAWc8FvwwiSYdt1r84fGOg.text: I think if one is looking to fall of the diet wagon, then make the fall memorable.  Benny's does that for me (as does Duck Donuts).  Big slices served piping hot remind me of the many divey pizza joints sprinkled like oregano all over the Northeast.  The pizza both smelled and tasted great; it also folded nicely and crunched oh so gently when taking a bite.  Mmmm . . . so good.  Ingredients were fresh, prices low, and ambience just the way I like it for fresh pie:  humble, divey, hipster, and cozy.  I say "Give 'em a whirl!"

photos.caption: Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States. So happy together  (and yummy, too)

ATBxqNsXzzga6r-LylC_7Q.text: Wow - where else can you get a giant slice of pizza cooked to order for $5!  First time I went, I ordered two slices and barely made it through the one slice.  No worries though, it was great heated up for lunch the next day.  They also have a great selection of beers available to drink with your pizza because there's no greater combo that pizza and beer!

2vsrvMJ9-QpCXPJPAe9G4Q.text: This is the biggest slice of pizza you will ever have! And it tastes amazing, the sauce they use is slightly sweet which compliments the saltiness of the cheese and crust beautifully. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a good pizza.

Ys4QJauwPNJu2lciFyR2Pw.text: What an awesome spot! My friends and I stopped in here after we'd made a stop at a bar, and the casual vibe and delicious, MASSIVE slices of pizza were just what the doctor ordered. This place knows what it's about and serves it up well.

JCAkmckw6xT4j53LA6AnkA.text: Hands down the BEST pizza in Charlotte! Love the atmosphere! Great location! Crust is perfectly made! Love the price! The workers are so cool!

KBQId9hRXXL7Nl7gnKBG-w.text: Been here several times and disappointed with the quality today. Ordered cheese slice and came out very over cooked . I should have sent it back but didn't want to wait. Also the music was awful and loud.

KcytuJDIr4eDEpu3StHB-A.text: This is how you get the most out of your cheat day!   Oh and check off another bookmark for 2017!!! Whoop!   I ordered the monthly meat special a slice of Lei'd (see what they did there?!) which comes topped with bacon, ham and pineapples.   It doesn't get any better than that!   It came out nice and hot straight from the oven, I topped with cheese and red pepper flakes and I couldn't have been happier.   Oh and did I mention like all the other reviews have that the slices here are ginormous! :)   Nice job! This pizza makes this Virginia girl very happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States. April Special - Lei&#39;d slice with ham, bacon and pineapple

D5OmjpkkO6PoXD35j0bMbw.text: 2 words.. good and simple...  Benny are known to serve up their 14"inches Slice pizza. And I wonder why it took me so long to finally  dine here.   Why it's good? Their crust. It's not to thin, not to thick and have a nice semi crunch to it.. which I seem to love. The sauce is not too much. And the ingredients are all good.   Why it's simple? They offered 4 basic pizzas...pepperoni, cheese, sausage, and garlic mushrooms. Then there's a monthly meat and monthly veggies. Those the the "specials" of the month. That's it.   You can't be a Starbucks customers here. Meaning you can't customize anything. What you see is what you get.. And for some reason I find this refreshing.. they don't do anything fancy., everything is served on paper plates. You order, they call your name, you pick up the slices. Self serve and bust your own table. Done.  They offered an awesome variety of can drinks. Local brewery to soda etc.   A nice cozy informal hang out spot with some good ole awesome pizzas..

photos.caption: Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Love love this. The Lei.. April &#34;Monthly Meat&#34; Ham, bacon and pineapple! Yummmmmm

wOQ6iyZHo09nC0UbVOeSJw.text: Relaxed atmosphere...humongus pizza slices...28" pizza pies...large soda selection...friendly staff...best pizza joint in NoDa!

photos.caption: Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Best pizza joint in NoDa!

ptUMn4CEFZJ20dyUbRZ2jw.text: I was super excited to try these famous large slices. The size of the pies and slices is spectacular, but the taste isn't. I bought a large cheese pie and brought it home to surprise my son. We were super excited to try it, but one bite and all excitement was lost. I couldn't even finish a slice and WE LOVE PIZZA! We tried to heat it up the next day and were only more disappointed. I really can't tell you what the issue is. Is it the sauce, the cheese or the crust? but the after taste is really bad. How can someone mess up pizza this badly!? Never going there again!  A waste of $30! So mad about that. If it were the usual $18 for a pie I would just keep it moving, but my god, 30! The two stars are for the unusual size of the slices. That is all...

photos.caption: Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States. I tried eating in different areas to see if it will eventually taste good

v3jrI8O3XsJA4bR71CicgQ.text: Great first experience at Benny's!  Staff was friendly and helpful, prices were very reasonable, and pizza was perfect!  Also grabbed myself a craft root beer to wash it down.  Will definitely be back.

73PFgOgYDSn_oLJ4wwSfEg.text: Literally the best pizza in Charlotte if you like thin crust the size of your face!! When you walk in the people are super nice and friendly. It's been a date spot for me and my lady when we want a chill night. And they are open late!!

hDXsnSgqkFGzdwGR9jkWVg.text: I thought I was coming in for a pleasant 2nd experience. Little did I know, I would be discriminated against and not even fed. Me and my 2 friends came in around 1230am and there were 5 people in the place. They were already eating. We each ordered 2 slices, bought 4 sodas, and sat down. As soon as we sat, a crowd came in. 15 min later, my 2 friends got 2 and 1 slice, my ticket and the other half of my friends ticket was not served. 20 people got their slices of pizza, after we asked repeatedly for ours for the next 30 mins. Finally, when I asked for my money back, the lady behind the counter hands me the last 2 slices sitting behind the counter. I felt so looked over and so disgusted by the way they ignored us repeatedly, promising our order over and over after serving everyone else that came in after us. I have never been a person to look at the color of skin, but I do feel that this was strongly a part of their decision not to serve me at all, and only serve half our other orders. I will never return, and being born and raised in Charlotte, this is a HUGE deal. God bless you.

TZTbQ2-qktcLQHfw-5B62A.text: Great, huge, tasty slices of New York style pizza. Love it! Staff is easy to talk with. Great place for a quick bite before a night on the town!

8jTYAub74Fjdl4DJu6-Ebg.text: Here we go. Okay...so you know how sometimes you will look up the reviews on a restaurant and pretty much everyone is RAVING about it? But then there are 1 or 2 people that say it is horrible...and you think to yourself "well it's just those few people...the majority of people love it!" so you try it out anyway and then wish you listened to those people? I'm going to be that person. Listen closely. To put it shortly for those that don't have the time to read a long rant: it's TERRIBLE do not go here! Go to Pure Pizza instead! It's only 10min away from this place and is amazing! Okay so for the rest of you here is my long rant. My husband and I went to go try this place yesterday (and before you think to yourself..."oh they're probably just some old married couple with no sense of taste...we're actually 26 and 28yrs old), we got there around 4:45pm and no one was in there...which was to be expected during that time. We ordered our pizza (I got the buffalo chicken and my husband got the garlic mushroom) and then sat down. All of the tables were GROSS. It had a "we're such a cool and hip place that we don't need to put any effort into cleaning" type of vibe to it. This place just opened I think about a week ago...you would think they would put more effort into cleanliness. And like I said, it was dead during this time so there was no excuse for someone not to be going around and cleaning the booths and tables. There were about 6 workers here during this time. There was powdered cheese all in the crevices of the table as well as all in the booths, I had to wipe it down before I sat. Even after this I still had hope...I can look past those things if the pizza is amazing. So the pizza came and the slices are huge...but that's where the positives end. I could tell right away they used cheap and poor ingredients. The "chicken" they used on my buffalo chicken pizza had those fake grill marks on them, you know what I'm talking about. Also it was just a slice of cheese pizza with the "chicken" buffalo sauce mixture piled on top. Like...the chicken wasn't actually baked into the pizza. Same goes with my husbands slice. It was a slice of cheese pizza with the mushrooms just piled on top. Super cheap ingredients. Low quality cheese. To top it off I asked the girl for a side of ranch and she told me it would be 50cents. I thought this was super tacky considering we had already sat down. To make it better I tried the ranch and it was not homemade ranch! I paid 50cents for bottled ranch! Horrible place and I'll never go back. Pure Pizza is 10min away from this place and they have amazing fresh pizza. They use very high quality ingredients. They source everything locally and both their crust and sauce are made from organic ingredients. Do yourself a favor and go there instead. Yes they are more expensive but there's a good reason why. I'm sure this place will flourish anyway. People who think they are hip and drunks will keep this place alive. End rant.

EvCn08b6UVM9gQ6ITN2UIQ.text: Blown away by the pizzas. 1 slice is bigger than my forearm. Great beer selection as well. You won't leave hungry.

CjC6faCHLDtBdsMYStaVrg.text: Friendly staff and huge slices. Great spot! I will definitely be back. I'm looking forward to when they serve beer. Maybe put up a few TVs, then it will be complete.

a4b99XJ4iF_rxK8VH_zNmA.text: Soooo good. Best pizza in charlotte. Wish they'd get a soda fountain though, no refills on cans.

_Ujz6IY0iomcuJKkf7Vkbg.text: Amazing! Best NY style pizza in Charlotte.  You only need a slice unless you are weak, then order two.

4C4BKy6VUYsT9dzOV7Pl2g.text: the cheese pizza is probably the best thing they have. whatever toppings you order on the slice will just get thrown on there and reheated. our toppings were still cold. Their slices are large but cost 4 to 5 dollars per slice. thin crust and crispy but definitely not that flavorful.

Xi4akuk9mXge3KjsWXPpcg.text: Great little dive pizza joint. It's the type of place you would expect by a college campus. The slices are huge and cheap which appeals to this mom of all boys.

mNWkP6391VBYxhWGlMP9WQ.text: I have been wanting to try this place for a while. As stated by others, the slices are HUGE. I ordered a slice of cheese and a slice of pepperoni. You pay and they call your name when your order is ready. Served on a paper plates, condiments on the counter and napkins for you to pick up. I think it's pretty legit pizza. The sauce is on the sweet side, the pepperoni creates just enough grease on the cheese but not too much. The crust is thin and crispy. I ordered an extra side of pizza sauce, perfect for dipping the crust in. I couldn't finish both slices but they sure were tasty. They only offer pizza, by the slice or whole pie as well as a few beers.  The dining area is pretty cool with a bar top and stools at the window looking out. There are also a few picnic tables outside.   Cool place-definitely check it out!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Huge slices!

vRb5psNlxC9huRrSWE9icA.text: Worth the drive to get there.  Huge slice of pizza, great taste.  Will definitely be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon jalapeño single slice, amazing!

NQAnv3-J2y89U2tWTMug9A.text: Hands down !! Best place for pizza in Charlotte. The slices are huge and absolutely delicious!!! I wish my stomach was bigger so I could eat more. Super trendy and hip and nice place to meet for a quick bite. Thumbs up!

rn8gAcAWaTazW8LZu_2qYA.text: BIG New York style pizza made my belly happy today for lunch  if you haven't checked out Benny's, YOU should

photos.caption: Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States

d6qZ1JNNnileuCkMaKGSAQ.text: Benny is a weekly visit for us. It's delicious. It's cheap. It's fast. You can't beat that. We usually visit on Friday or Saturday around dinner time and even though the place is small, there's always somewhere for us to sit. I promise you one slice is enough. We got a whole pie once and couldn't eat it in a week, it's 30''! Had to put it in the trunk of my car! We eat for two for $11. Two slices, two sodas. We leave full! You really can't beat that! Best pizza in CLT, hands down and now we drive from Mount Holly!

7laGzCGlyodv0VfuJePgdw.text: I decided to celebrate National Running Day yesterday by not running and going here to eat pizza instead. #amidoingitright  This place is right next to Heist. My friend Sammy, aka the pizza expert, has been talking about about Benny's for what seems like forever. He went to VA Tech, so he knew all about the Virginia slice concept.   The slices are the size of your head. Actually, they're bigger than your head. By the slice, it's $4-$5. It's so large that it needs two plates. As for the pie, it's 28". TWENTY-EIGHT. I'm not even sure how they heave these things into the oven. Cheese is $30 and topping types $38.  I decided to get a piece of each monthly special, the buffalo chicken and the garlic mushroom. Did I need two pieces? No. Did I finish them both. Nope. Not even close. I love the crust. It's thin, crisp, and perfect.   This place just completely changed the late night scene in NoDa. Benny's is open until 2am on Thursdays, 3am Fridays and Saturdays, and midnight all the other days.   They just opened a couple nights ago, so they do have a few kinks to work out in the beginning. Pretty cool to see a King of Pops cooler right up at the front. Congrats and good luck Benny's! We are so excited to have you here.

-k25Zidw-hgrAoRWm7lslw.text: Best pizza north of uptown and best pizza by the slice in Charlotte. All you need is one slice and a local beer and you'll have a whole meal in front of you for 8 bucks. If you don't need the beer the price is 4-5 bucks a slice. So back to the point. The Virginia slice is literally the biggest slice of pizza you'll ever have. They serve it on two paper plate and it still hangs off the edge.   They have 2 specials every month as well as the basic toppings. I've never had a special that I didn't like. Everything is made right in front of you and you can choose to sit as a booth or table or at a bar. They even have a picnic table right outside for the nice days.   Located right beside Heist brewery this is an excellent stop while in NoDa. You can also order to go and be the hit of any party/tailgate by bringing a 30 inch pizza with you. Talk about an easy way to make friends. But seriously go check out Benny's

R04AnYgkfaLxo-QUcTysZQ.text: This new-ish establishment in NoDa is sure to become a staple. The pizza is HUGE. 28" pizzas make for 14" slices. They offer your basic cheese or pepperoni, and then have two special choices they rotate monthly. No beer/wine/liquor here, so don't come planning to throw back a Peroni with your pizza. Benny's is open late-night, so it's a sure-fire place to get your drunk-food fix after a night at Heist or Growler's. It's NY Style (to me) that's pre-baked, and then thrown back in to heat up upon your order. So if you love that, this is a great choice.   Sidenote: There are no sides/breaksticks/garlic knots offered, which was definitely a let down for me. I love me some breadsticks with my pizza. Literally just pizza and soda/water served here.

photos.caption: Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chorizo &amp; queso pizza
Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States. For size reference

CvWHvDi3u2TI6agGn-Cqeg.text: Having eaten at Benny Tudinos in Hoboken, I had to stop in and try Benny Penellos. I'm not sure what's in the name, but it seems as if the name Benny is synonymous with huge slices. I grabbed 3 slices, all different, all I think fairly priced for the size.   My impression on the taste? Very salty, but not horrible. Absolutely perfect place for stopping after a night out drinking. I would classify it as munchie pizza. I won't be going back unless i stumble out of Heist Brewery which is next door.

photos.caption: Photo of Benny Pennello's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Slices of cheese, pepperoni and buffalo chicken.

p6my4hLvObLSx_jPmJZO7w.text: Hungry in NoDa and love pizza... say no more... go to Bennys.   Very simple menu, five or six choices of pizza max for anywhere between $4-$5 each a slice. However, the slice is the size of a small country. They only make 28' pizzas (ie: four times the size of a regular large pizza). One maybe two will definitely fill you up. They have a good selection of beer by the can and it's a very laid back atmosphere.   They have a pizza challenge, an entire pizza in one hour, I'm going to try to do it one day. Wish me luck.

6QXtzNYLek7hFCAc9wvKKg.text: I just tried them today and I loved it! Giant pieces of pizza, beer, soda what else could you want for a cheap awesome lunch?! I definitely will be back

HJ5WOiQMpLeZJ1u0a6iv9Q.text: I've heard about Benny's for a while now and their ginormous slices of pizza ( seriously 14"!!), and decided to give it a try after 5 drinks deep at happy hour.   First of all, it's located right by heist brewery in Noda which is a perfect location! It's also open till 3am so it's great for that 4th meal. They do not have alcohol, but are planning to have it available within the next month.   The pizzas are premade (New York thin crust style), however they cook the pizzas with the toppings fresh each time. So be prepared to wait 5-10minutes. Slices range from $4-$5, but trust me 1 piece is enough. You can get two if you feel extra frisky. They also offer full pizzas (28 whopping inches!!) around $30-38 depending on the toppings. Pizza is the only thing on the menu so don't expect to get garlic bread, etc.   I tried the monthly special which was curry banana pepper.The pizza had good flavor, but I was expecting more. I was unimpressed with my choice. It was good, but nothing to rave about. The crust is surprisingly good- however ask for a side of sauce or ranch. It gets a little dry.   Keep in mind this pizza is New York style. If that's your thing you will love Benny's. For me this was more of a drunk food/late night kind of place. However I would like to return and try a different flavor. That might change my view on Benny's.   Overall, for the money, it's a great deal and you can never go wrong than pizza!

nHntBmT6EHyu8gOVerqExA.text: Maaaaaan  this pizza is good af!!! And the atmosphere is really chill. Talk should  come get some slices. This that new York style  too... Whhhhheeeeew.

Uq0pztGxGBalXeYreQBwHw.text: Great vibes, and affordable! Right in the heart of noda.

_o3c7YcLOQarvL2gFDTfQg.text: Fantastic, massive, delicious pizza slices!!! This place knows how to do pizza! Not to mention, they are open on the weekends until 3am!!! They should open another spot in south Charlotte! I had a pepperoni pizza with garlic cloves and garlic sauce. Isn't not possible to OD on garlic, right? So good and so cheap!! If you're in the area and need pizza, this place! Do it!

vZBxAnDDMER72ILElWy3sQ.text: Holy Pizza! I knew I had to try this place from the size of their pizza slices. I never go to any pizzeria and not order 2 slices for myself, but when I saw how big these were I stuck to just one slice. Good thing, because I struggled to finish it off.   Lots of seating, good service. I rarely travel to NoDa, but I'll be back to have another single slice late night.

oaA0wFVH_wRhiewBsiW86w.text: Best Pizza in NODA.  Since Revolution closed it's really the only pizza in NODA now.  It's great pizza though.  Very simple, basic, good pizza.  The dough, crust, sauce, cheese and 5 or so toppings are solid.  It's not joke, this is the biggest pizzas I've ever seen.  I couldn't fit the box in my car without opening the trunk.  It's $5 for a slice and that's all that most people should need.  Great pizza for a great price.  Wish they had more toppings and the beer selection is small but that's not why I would go there.    ***  I live in the middle of NODA and have been everywhere in the neighborhood many times over the past years. These reviews are a culmination of lots of visits so it's more of a consistency rating than anything.  If you are going out in NODA I've got reviews up of all the places in the neighborhood if you're looking to compare.  ***

QIw2eu7jM7iKa_ItEpH6gA.text: So.... I have found my favorite pizza place in charlotte. Directly next to Heist brewing is this gem. It's definitely a hipster joint. The pizza slices are about the size of half a large pizza. No joke- it comes on two paper plates! I had the meatball pizza and my husband had the pepperoni. They were both amazing. The crust is thin and crispy and the sauce is tasty and the cheese gooey. It had a thick end crust. I recommend getting ranch dipping sauce. We will definitely be back!

-wKlygFIyCXTVQLD6-UDwg.text: Way better than the pretentious hipster d bag establishment next door (Heist Brewery).  Pizza slices are large.

xEUxWwFbT1js4rC_jnM_ow.text: We came here last night after arriving in Charlotte! I obviously had to try this place while in Charlotte because pizza the size of my head... duh!! When we got there, there was a small line but it moved quickly. This place just has the basics and I was okay with it. They have slices that start at $4 and go from there. They have dipping sauces (the garlic was clutch with the pizza), pop, water, and some beer. I decided on a pepperoni slice and garlic dipping sauce. The pizzas are already cooked and then they are reheated to order. Our order didn't take long to come up. These slices are literally two papers plates long. It's a v thin style crust, which is perfect for folding in half and eating it NY style. Honestly.. everything was good about my slice of pizza. It had a wonderfully crispy crust, melty cheese, and just enough grease to make it a good pizza! As I'm typing this review, I kinda wish I could just walk over to Benny's and grab a slice for breakfast...lol but seriously, go check this place out for a late night bite(s). You won't be disappointed!

Z76RCwjsBfRcw-ENemryeQ.text: ***UPDATE 8/16/18***  Previously I had given Benny's 2 stars based on my experience but after my tip issue was resolved, I can add back another star. I have added the email conversation between the owner & I and it seems as though the employee adding extra tip was unintentional. Hopefully the phone usage will be greatly reduced. I understand it's not always busy and you want to check your phone once in awhile but you're still on the clock and should still be paying attention to customers.  I'll still be back because the pizza is that good.  Original Review  Last Monday night around 11 PM, I had a pizza craving and wanted to check out Benny's. LA and I decided since it was pretty close to closing for the night that we would check it out the next day. So we did!  I stuck with their cheese slice and LA wanted a meat lovers slice. There is no meat lovers pizza on their menu but they were able to make one by adding additional toppings ($1 each) to their monthly meat special. So LA got a slice of the Bacon Cheeseburger with sausage and pepperoni added to it. It took about 10 minutes for the pizzas to come out and they did not disappoint! Huge slices, deliciously crispy crust, and a generous amount of toppings on the meat lovers slice. My only complaint about the pizza was I wish there was a little less sauce and more cheese, but that is my personal preference. I read some other reviews stating that one slice would make you full or whatever, but since I'm now eating for 2, I definitely felt like I could've eaten another slice and then be satisfied. We decided to order a couple more slices to go but this is where the problem starts..  I got up to the counter to order more pizza but the dude working (different guy from the one who initially helped us out) was more interested in playing with his phone than paying attention to customers. I decided not to say anything and see how long it would take him to realize I was standing there. I probably waited a solid couple of minutes before he looked up and saw me. He quickly apologized and took my order. It came out to $11 and I left a $2 tip (18%) though he didn't even deserve 10%. I remember writing very clearly $2.00 and $13.00. He asked me if I wanted a receipt to which I replied no and that was it. Pizzas were ready in about 10 minutes, and LA and I went back home, after running a few errands.   A few days later, I had checked my bank account and saw a posted transaction from Benny's that was $14.00 when it should have been $13.00. Now, I'm not mad that I lost a dollar but it's just the principle of the matter. Employees adding more tip than what the customers write down is shady AF, plus the service I received wasn't that great to begin with and he was lucky I left anything at all. Apparently my 18% tip wasn't good enough and he thought he deserved 27%, idk?  I'll still be back because the pizzas are good and they are open late. However, I will be paying cash from now on and I'm sorry but unfortunately I feel less inclined to leave a tip because that was pretty lame of you Benny's.  TL;DR 4 stars because the pizza is good and they are open late 1 star because customer service isn't great and some employees add more tip than what the customers write down If you pay by card, ALWAYS ask for a receipt or just play it safe and pay with cash

tyH4Qi8WuJ3hx6WXS37Zmg.text: My friends have been coming here for a while with their kids. I've always wanted to try it so today after the funny bus pointed it out we did an early dinner. Five adults, good eaters. We ordered one 28' with half and half toppings. The pizza was amazing and we could not finish it all. I have lunch for tomorrow for three people. A must do for a group but if you don't like people, they do by the slice. Yummy

q03zT2FzsuCpWPxH1zfmPQ.text: Best Pizza I've had since I moved Charlotte bar none! Will definitely be eatin here a few times a month! Only thing that would make it better is expanding toppings.

ywjlBYUh79PTEjgpbom6xA.text: This is a place that is different from normal pizza places.  They have a limited number of choices for toppings and sell huge slices of pizza.  The price of whole pizza are priced high enough that unless you have a large group that wants the same topping, you are best to get it by the slice  I got the cheese because that was the only topping that I liked. The pizza is good, but I live in an area that has the best pizza in the country. It also has the topped rated pizza restaurant in the country ( Frank Pepe), so it's hard to give this place 5 stars if I compare it with that I get back home.  The reason for my rating is that this place lacked choices for topping and it's oven is not hot enough ( coal or wood brick oven) to blacken the crust.  However the crust is very thin, which I like. Also the restrooms were not the cleanest.   However for North Carolina Pizza it's very good.  They also play oldies , which I love.

rwKw4YUivbt6Nwwk5oIO4w.text: I absolutely loved this pizza! It didn't have too much cheese or sause which made it perfect. The largest pizza is MASSIVE, I would only suggest ordering it if you are in a group of 3-6 people.

cHn5GIfs_WwuFK82sdndNw.text: We actually went here by accident trying to get to Heist Brewery (which is around the corner) and no we weren't already drunk, LOL.  I ordered a slice of plain cheese ( adventurous, I know) and my mom ordered the chicken, bacon, ranch slice and of course we got a few locally brewed beers. The pizza was ready pretty quickly and being the ranch connoisseur that I am, I ordered 2 cups extra.   The pizza was HUGE and delicious! They also have a pizza contest running: whoever can eat and entire pie wins $500! I highly doubt I could even come close to doing that but I'd like to see the person who would

oWU-4j82dKLhb3EtX2Msgw.text: I went here with my boyfriend while we were out celebrating one of my friends 22nd birthday. We were at jack beagles originally which is a few blocks away and boyf was getting haaangry so we asked around of a place that we could quickly get him something and be back to the party without anyone noticing and in time to pay our tab before everyone left. They recommended this place for the shear size of the pizza slices and the convenience. When we got there, we stood in line for about 5 minutes then he finally ordered and literally only got one slice of cheese pizza. We sat down and waited for them to call it, we weren't sure If we were supposed to be sitting down or if we were supposed to be standing out by the counter it seem like there were a few people doing both so that aspect is a little bit confusing. We started to get impatient after waiting like 10 minutes, then started to get annoyed when The people who came in behind us were getting served before us with bigger orders. The interior is cute and the food is good but I wouldn't recommend coming here if you want to get in and out quickly.

S8sOJt_qy5S8bXMx5TgDWg.text: Benny's serves novelty sized slices of greasy pizza for a fair price at a convenient location in the neighborhood. Although their slices are unnecessarily large, the pizza itself isn't really that great.

2gdh7kuqD3aVrv7O81iDcA.text: Me and my love, love Benny's! The staff is always friendly and conversational, great vibe, HUGE ASS PIZZA SLICES for about $3-5 a slice. Their menu selection is small but by the time you see how big the slices are, that doesn't really matter :)

yPcvALn57dvwhIBFntvkRA.text: This pizza is EVERYTHING. My favorite day to come here is on Sundays. I always get the pepperoni and when I'm really hungry I'll get two slices even though they are HUGE. If I ever want pizza this is my first choice, the slices are around $5.50 each but they are worth it. The vibe there is very indie and chill. It can get crowded on the weekends. There are a few booths, two bar style sitting areas, 2 big community tables and around 5 high top tables. Nice place for cool pics as well.

i3RrL2W9qoa-u0aF6je-lA.text: Hi Benny's  Your food is really good but this review isn't about that. I wanted to give you a rating on your pizza boxes. I recently ordered 2 slices to go which were conveniently placed in a box that would fit a large pizza at some other chump sized pizza store. The box did a great job protecting my food, but when I got home I realized my cats couldn't stay away from the box. They've been sleeping on it for about a week now with no end in sight. I did some experiments to better understand if they just liked the shape of the box, or just like defined spaces (see attached photo) but every time they go straight to the box. It's pretty neat.

RewBwvTzn2FgJqSFit4qTg.text: Definitely time to update my review!  Really happy to see Benny's thriving in NODA - they've become part of the landscape!  Love to come here with my kids when we're hanging out or running errands - they can split a $4 slice and be full - that's just how big those slices are! The monthly specials add a little "spice to life"! They've added beer and have a nice selection of local beer at a reasonable price.   Keep up the great work guys and gals!! One of my favorite pizza joints in Charlotte!
